title: Setting Up Development Environment & Hello World

questions.question: What does JDK stand for?
questions.explanation: JDK stands for Java Development Kit, which contains all tools needed to develop Java applications.

questions.question: Which command compiles a Java source file?
questions.explanation: javac is the Java compiler command that converts .java source files into .class bytecode files.

questions.question: What file extension do compiled Java programs have?
questions.explanation: Compiled Java programs have the .class extension, containing bytecode that runs on the JVM.

questions.question: What does the static keyword mean in the main method?

options.value: The method belongs to the class itself, not individual objects

questions.explanation: static means the method belongs to the class itself rather than to individual object instances.
println prints each string on a separate line, so "Hello" appears on the first line and "World" on the second.

questions.question: What does void mean in the main method signature?
questions.explanation: void indicates that the method does not return any value when it completes execution.

questions.question: Which symbol ends every Java statement?
questions.explanation: Every Java statement must end with a semicolon (;) to indicate the end of the statement.

questions.question: What must match exactly between the class name and filename?
questions.explanation: The class name must exactly match the filename including capitalization. HelloWorld class must be in HelloWorld.java.

questions.question: What does String[] args represent in the main method?
questions.explanation: String[] args represents command-line arguments that can be passed to the program when it starts.

questions.question: Which IDE is commonly used for Java development?
questions.explanation: Eclipse is a popular IDE for Java development, along with IntelliJ IDEA and Visual Studio Code.

questions.question: What symbols define code blocks in Java?
questions.explanation: Curly braces { } define code blocks in Java, grouping statements together within methods and classes.

questions.question: What happens when you compile a Java program with syntax errors?

options.value: Compilation fails and displays error messages

questions.explanation: If there are syntax errors, compilation fails and the compiler displays error messages indicating what needs to be fixed.

questions.question: What does System.out.println() do?

options.value: Prints text to the console followed by a new line

questions.explanation: System.out.println() prints the specified text to the console and then moves to the next line.

questions.question: Is Java case-sensitive?

options.value: No, all letters are treated the same
Yes, System and system are different

questions.explanation: Java is case-sensitive, meaning System and system are completely different identifiers.

questions.question: What component is part of the JDK?
questions.explanation: The Java compiler (javac) is a key component of the JDK, used to compile .java files into bytecode.

questions.question: What should you do before running a Java program?
questions.explanation: You must first compile the .java source file using javac to create the .class bytecode file before running it.
